justification: "The continuous performance task was used to measure impulsivity and inhibitory control of reflexive actions (Horn et al., 2003)."
"A modified version of the Wheel of Fortune (WOF) task was administered to test propensity of risk-taking and gambling strategies (Ernst et al., 2004)."
"Individual preference between small, immediate vs. large, delayed rewards was tested … in the Temporal Delay Discounting Task (TD)."
construct: delay discounting / preference for immediate vs. delayed reward

justification: The Emotional Face Recognition Task presented actors’ facial expressions and accuracy/reaction time "were averaged … to compose estimates of performance for recognizing negative emotion."
construct: emotional face recognition / positive and negative emotion perception

measured_by: Behavioral Inhibition System (BIS) subscale of the BIS/BAS Scale
justification: "Adolescents completed The Behavioral Inhibition System/Behavioral Activation System (BIS/BAS) Scale to provide a measure of appetitive and avoidant behavioral tendencies."

measured_by: BAS-Drive subscale of the BIS/BAS Scale
justification: The BAS is "divided into three subscales," one of which is the "independent drive (BAS-D; four items)" capturing reward pursuit.

measured_by: BAS-Fun Seeking subscale of the BIS/BAS Scale
justification: The BAS includes a "fun-seeking (BAS-FS; four items)" subscale assessing pursuit of novel pleasurable activities.

measured_by: BAS-Reward Responsivity subscale of the BIS/BAS Scale
justification: The BAS also contains a "reward responsivity (BAS-RR; five items)" subscale measuring excitement to anticipated rewards.
"All participants were also assessed for verbal and performance IQ using the Kaufman Brief Intelligence Test (KBIT)."
"Risk for future adverse outcomes … was measured with the revised Drug Use Screening Inventory (DUSI-R; 153 items)."

measured_by: Violence Proneness metric (DUSI-VP) derived from DUSI-R
justification: "The DUSI-R was used to compute a metric for Violence Proneness (DUSI-VP) – an estimation of the risk of experiencing violence in early adulthood."
"Adolescents … completed a pubertal development scale (Carskadon and Acebo, 1993) to measure … physical changes with age at each wave."
